column4: I am having issues with my AR9285 wireless card where it's extremely slow under linux.
pastebin the output of ifconfig and I'll try to find out the problem
any advice?
I have a similar problem...Type in "ifconfig wlan0 down" then type "iwconfig rate 54M" then finish it off by typing "ifconfig wlan0 up" then reconnecting to the access point and see what that does
Scratch that...The iwconfig line should read "iwconfig wlan0 rate 54M"
Did that work?
it didn't work
Hmm...Pastebin the output of iwconfig wlan0 and I'll have another look
http://pastebin.com/m75bf1b1e
I see the problem...The bitrate needs to be changed manually...Did you try what I said?
What's the closest wifi to you?
The hotel wireless network, but this other laptop right next to me gets signal just fine.
This is why I am puzzled:  Link Quality=2/70
Hmm...Where are you in the hotel?
The only other thing I can think of is try using a USB wireless dongle
That may be your only option, unfortunately
I have not heard good things about the netbooks
The "micro laptops" like the netbooks sacrifice usability and battery life for cuteness
hm; I heard good things about ndiswrapper on this netbook
I would try the ndiswrapper, but don't get your hopes up
I can't even get ndiswrapper to work is the problem.
